topic.title: How to Use Part, Chapter and Sections Numbers in Links

body.p: Let us assume you have a link in the third chapter that points to a paragraph in the first chapter, the second subsection, and you need this structural information (1.2) presented to the user, just after the link text. In case you can use the target-counters CSS function to extract the entire context of counters from the target. The chapter-and-sections built-in counter is already updated with both the chapter number and the nested sections:
This counter does not include the part number, so take care when linking between parts: you may consider adding the target part number explicitly:
